title: I'll "RISK" It
body_text:
RISK Rules and Regulations
"The Writer" indeed agrees - this should be very, very interesting. What should be a violent, brutal variation of the dreaded
BoxBall Dodgeball
makes its shocking debut at the 124th dodgeball extravaganza. Below are the rules and regulations of such a match-up, so please read carefully.
Map 1
The first illustration depicts the set up of this unorthodox new gametype. Players are equally divided into four armies and are positioned on their respective courts as seen to the right. Enemy fire will come from all
three
opposing squads in an effort to seize territory and capture enemies.
Map 2
The second graph shows how one army's collapse is another's advantage. Team 1 has just eliminated the last remaining soldier on Team 2. With that kill, Team 2 not only gives up their territory, but must now fight alongside Team 1 against the other two surviving squads.
Keep in mind, there's always the possibility of Team 3 capturing Team 4's land and soldiers, and vice versa. Though it would be extremely difficult, Team 3 could even conquer the now-doubled Team 1.
Map 3
In the event that Team 3 falls to the colossal Team 1, Team 4 must now fend off the non-stop barrage while remaining in their tight corner. If Team 4 somehow manages to defeat Team 1, then Team 4 would come out victorious in that game.
Read Carefully!
*Once an entire army has been taken down, they immediately rejoin the fray beside the army that took them out.
*Only the
final kill
decides which team has conquered which. Like the example above, if Team 1 kills Team 2's last remaining player, then Team 2 joins forces with Team 1.
*Points are earned only to the army who has not been eliminated. In Map 3, if Team 1 were to eliminate everyone from Team 4, then Team 1 scores the point for the round. Teams 2 and 3 despite aligned with Team 1 do not score any points.
DODGEBALL 124 hits Wall High School on February 2, 2008.
Do not miss out on this rare battle!

RISK Rules and Regulations
"The Writer" indeed agrees - this should be very, very interesting. What should be a violent, brutal variation of the dreaded BoxBall Dodgeball makes its shocking debut at the 124th dodgeball extravaganza. Below are the rules and regulations of such a match-up, so please read carefully.


Map 1
The first illustration depicts the set up of this unorthodox new gametype. Players are equally divided into four armies and are positioned on their respective courts as seen to the right. Enemy fire will come from all three opposing squads in an effort to seize territory and capture enemies.







Map 2
The second graph shows how one army's collapse is another's advantage. Team 1 has just eliminated the last remaining soldier on Team 2. With that kill, Team 2 not only gives up their territory, but must now fight alongside Team 1 against the other two surviving squads.

Keep in mind, there's always the possibility of Team 3 capturing Team 4's land and soldiers, and vice versa. Though it would be extremely difficult, Team 3 could even conquer the now-doubled Team 1.


Map 3
In the event that Team 3 falls to the colossal Team 1, Team 4 must now fend off the non-stop barrage while remaining in their tight corner. If Team 4 somehow manages to defeat Team 1, then Team 4 would come out victorious in that game.








Read Carefully!
*Once an entire army has been taken down, they immediately rejoin the fray beside the army that took them out.
*Only the final kill decides which team has conquered which. Like the example above, if Team 1 kills Team 2's last remaining player, then Team 2 joins forces with Team 1.
*Points are earned only to the army who has not been eliminated. In Map 3, if Team 1 were to eliminate everyone from Team 4, then Team 1 scores the point for the round. Teams 2 and 3 despite aligned with Team 1 do not score any points.


DODGEBALL 124 hits Wall High School on February 2, 2008.
Do not miss out on this rare battle!
